snippet: The latest court decision is likely to set off years more of court battles in Italy and possibly the United States, legal experts said.
abstract: Amanda Knox, in interview with ABC's Good Morning America, says she will not return to Italy willingly; Italian appeals court upheld her 2009 conviction for the murder two years earlier of Meredith Kercher, her roommate in a student apartment in Perugia; legal experts say latest decision is likely to set off years more of court battles in Italy and possibly the United States.

byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The latest court decision is likely to set off years more of court battles in Italy and possibly the United States, legal experts said.

headline.main: Amanda Knox, Found Guilty in Italy Killing, Vows to Fight Extradition
headline.print_headline: American Found Guilty in Italy Killing Vows to Fight Extradition
